content.title: Looking for advice from community
points: Parent dismisses their feelings about their drinking
Parent controls life and still sees them as a child
Family guilt trips them
Husband helps them to set boundaries
Feels guilt and self-doubt when setting boundaries with parent
replies: Advice for poster → it’s okay to set boundaries, it’s not selfish, guilt vs shame, recommended books

content.title: Parent has been through trauma
points: Helped raise themselves and their siblings
Grew up acutely aware of parents’ emotions
Worried about their parents’ emotions
Parents’ problems became their own
Parent ignores boundaries
Feel bad for sticking to boundaries of low contact

content.title: Gone low contact with parent to protect their own family
points: Hate seeing parent sad and lonely
Feel bad for parent but I know who she is

content.title: Mixed emotions; mother died from alcoholism and wedding is coming up
points: Sadness mother won't be there but also relief that she isn’t there to ruin the day like most special occasions
Guilt about not wanting to invite father to wedding
Knows what they should do but guilt is consuming them - feel horrible
replies: Lots relating about wedding planning, parent sabotaging good things, guilt vs shame

content.title: Switch flipped in me when parent was hospitalised due to drinking
points: Feel guilty for setting boundaries
Parent has done a lot for me
Parent doesn’t see the issue with their drinking
I have guilt for treating them badly but I have a lot of resentment

content.title: Conversations with husband about how to handle parent when they have kids
points: Parent put grandchild in danger due to drinking
Parent is guilt tripping me, makes me feel crazy for being upset with them

content.title: Guilt for leaving siblings, but need to be free
points: Know I should focus on myself but I can’t help feelings
replies: Reassure the need to focus on self
Insight from someone who was the sibling left behind

content.title: Hurts when parent is nice
points: Guilt for thinking bad things
Easier to cope when they’re mean and unsupportive
replies: Empathise; harder with mixed behaviours, advice on how to deal with this

content.title: Need to know I’m not the first person to go through this
points: No desire to have children because raising my mom was enough
I feel like the parent
As she calls me and vents/cries, I just sit and listen
She used to call me coldhearted but it’s just a defence mechanism to protect self
Tried distancing self, but it’s so draining
Always felt the need to defend my mom, I’m the only one who gets her
I wonder if I’d send her into a drinking spiral if I put all of this on the table
I know something has to change, but I have constant fear and guilt of what it’ll do to her

content.title: 35 years old, in a weird purgatory
points: I think it might be better when they’re gone. But I know it won’t. I feel guilty for typing that, scared of the guilt I’ll feel.

content.title: No contact with mom and guilt is hitting me hard
points: I know mom’s feelings are not my responsibility, I know that in my head
Every cell in my body is screaming 'you have to fix this and make her feel better'
Role reversal
I know there’s nothing I can do to help her
Guilt, emotional pain, anxiety
I don’t want to contact her but I feel like I should

content.title: I was warned about feelings of guilt when I considered going no contact
points: Not true in my case → giant weight has been lifted off of me

content.title: For most of my 20s, I never shared that my parent were alcoholics
points: Me and husband distanced ourselves greatly
No contact is easier because I don’t have the tools to explain to them all how I feel
I have kids, so I need to have strong boundaries
Felt shame for sharing my experience with SIL
I always feel stupid for opening up and I feel like I have nothing worthwhile to share

content.title: Felt 100% responsible for mom’s alcoholism between ages 8-12 years
points: It was unbearable, frightening and completely destroyed me
Something I carry with me to this day
Spend hours and hours ruminating on something I’ve done and whether it makes me a bad person, or being anxious over things that might happen
Does anyone else have this?
replies: I have the guilt and ruminating feelings, I know this came from dysfunctional childhood
It’s crazy how these thoughts and feelings are stuck in us

content.title: Anyone else envy normal families?
replies: Yup, extremely envious. Always wonder how my life would've been different.

Same here. I resent them for getting everything so easy compared to me even though I try really hard not to. Every time I go to one of my friends' houses and interact for a whole day I come home feeling empty and cry hard all the way.

content.title: I’ve never heard of ACA until this year during therapy
points: Since then I have realised how much growing up with an alcoholic parent has affected me in life and definitely affected my relationships.
I tend to be a people pleaser but also avoid conflict at all cost.
Sometimes I just isolate myself or shut down completely to avoid conflict. My therapist called it stonewalling.
I have a hard time opening up and being vulnerable even with my partner of 3 years.
Ultimately this has negatively affected my relationship
replies: Same to everything you just said. And when I DO get vulnerable, I just sob uncontrollably even though I’m trying hard not to.
This post was made for me, I relate to a lot of what you said. We’ve been doing communication therapy which has helped a lot. It is possible to improve this but you have to do the work.

content.title: Finding it hard to determine when I should show compassion for my dad
points: When to draw a boundary without being riddled with guilt.
I have deep guilt in life generally but especially with my parents who cannot possibly take care of themselves.
I have my own internal rules of when to help them but they’re inconsistent due to guilt and lack of boundaries
My therapist explained to me that I am the child, he is the parent
